feed.title: Google Cloud: Identity and Access Management
feed.subtitle: Changelog for Google Cloud product: Identity and Access Management

entry.content:
A new infinite-scrolling UI for audit logs is available on the Privileged Access Manager > Audit logs page in the Google Cloud console. This interface update replaces pagination with clear data loading indicators and time boundaries to help facilitate event investigations.

This feature is in preview.
entry.summary: A new infinite-scrolling interface for audit logs is now available. This update enhances event investigations by replacing pagination with clear data loading indicators and time boundaries. This feature is currently in preview.
entry.title: Feature: Audit Logs UI Update

entry.content:
For Privileged Access Manager, notification emails for grant activation, activation failure, or denial no longer include approver details.

To learn how to view the approver details, see Check grant status.
entry.summary: Notification emails for Privileged Access Manager (PAM) grant activation, failure, or denial no longer display approver details. For instructions on viewing this information, refer to the documentation on checking grant status.
entry.title: Changed: Privileged Access Manager: Approver Details Removed from Emails

entry.content:
Privileged Access Manager (PAM) offers the following features in preview:

  • Multi-level and multi-party approvals
  • Scope customization
  • Service account approvals
  • Inheritance support
  • Notification preferences customization
  • Grant withdrawal
entry.summary: Privileged Access Manager (PAM) is now available in preview. It offers features such as multi-level and multi-party approvals, scope customization, service account approvals, inheritance support, notification preferences customization, and grant withdrawal.
entry.title: Feature: Privileged Access Manager (PAM)

entry.content:
IAM offers predefined roles that are tailored to specific job functions. These roles cover all of the permissions that a user might need to perform their job. This feature is generally available.

For more information, see Predefined roles for job functions.
entry.summary: IAM now offers predefined roles for specific job functions, making it easier to manage permissions.
entry.title: Feature: Predefined Roles

entry.content: Permission errors in the Google Cloud console contain actionable steps for remediation. For more information, see Troubleshoot permission error messages.
entry.summary: Permission errors in the Google Cloud console now include steps to help you fix them.
entry.title: Feature: Troubleshoot permission errors

entry.content:
Privileged Access Manager (PAM) now offers the following features in preview:

  • Multi-level and multi-party approvals
  • Scope customization
  • Service account approvals
  • Inheritance support
  • Notification preferences customization
entry.summary: Privileged Access Manager (PAM) is now available in preview, introducing features like multi-level approvals, scope customization, and service account approvals.
entry.title: Feature: Privileged Access Manager now in preview

entry.content:
Notification emails for grant activation or denial no longer include approver details.

To view the approver details, navigate to the IAM & Admin > Privileged Access Manager > Grants page on the Google Cloud Console.
entry.summary: Approver details are no longer included in grant activation or denial emails. You can find this information on the Google Cloud Console by navigating to IAM & Admin > Privileged Access Manager > Grants.
entry.title: Changed: Grant activation/denial emails updated

entry.content:
You can ask Gemini for predefined role suggestions using the IAM role picker in the Google Cloud Console. This feature is in preview.

For more information, see Get predefined role suggestions with Gemini assistance.
entry.summary: Gemini can now suggest predefined IAM roles to help you manage access in Google Cloud. This feature is currently in preview.
entry.title: Feature: Gemini assists with IAM role suggestions

entry.content: Conditions that check the tags for a resource can also check other attributes, such as the resource name of the timestamp of the request. This feature is available in Preview. For more information, see Resource tags.
entry.summary: Conditions for resource tags can now also check other attributes like resource name and request timestamp. This feature is currently in Preview.
entry.title: Changed: Attribute conditions for resource tags now available in Preview

entry.content: Workforce Identity Federation supports detailed audit logging, which you can use to troubleshoot attribute mapping issues. This feature is generally available.
entry.summary: You can now audit workforce identity federation with detailed audit logging to help troubleshoot attribute mapping issues. This feature is generally available.
entry.title: Feature: Workforce Identity Federation Now Supports Detailed Audit Logging
